fullText: Mr. Mamet has created a work that feels both urgently contemporary and classically structured, a meditation on justice, guilt and the stories we tell ourselves to make sense of an unsensible world.

bwwExcerpt: Though the play made pointed use of sexual and ethnic words that are still seldom heard in polite discussion, these elicited far more giggles than gasps. I couldn’t help longing for the days when a new play by Mr. Mamet so knocked the breath out of you that you wouldn’t think of standing up afterward until you were sure your legs would support you.
